metadata.title: Inferring hominoid and early hominid phylogeny using craniodental characters: the role of fossil taxa

characters.name: SG1. Projection of nasal bones above frontomaxillary suture
SG2. Inferior orbital margin rounded laterally
SG5. Nasoalveolar clivus contour in coronal plane
SG6. Protrusion of incisor alveoli beyond bicanine line (basal view)
SG9. Height of the masseter origin
SG10. M-L thickness of zygomatic arch at root of frontal process
SG11. Anterior projection of zygomatic bone relative to piriform aperture (dishing)
SG13. Index of palate protrusion anterior to sellion (facial prognathism)
SG14. Masseteric position relative to sellion
SG18. O-M sinus present in high frequency
SG19. Antero-medial incursion of the superior temporal lines
SG20. Sagittal crest present, at least in presumptive males
SG21. Compound T/N crest, at least in presumptive males
SG23. Parietal overlap of occipital at asterion, at least in males
SG24. Squamosal suture overlap extensive, at least in males
SG25. Lateral inflation of mastoid process relative to supramastoid crest
SG31. Horizontal distance between TMJ and M2/M3
SG32. Relative depth of mandibular fossa
SG33. Postglenoid process size and position
SG35. Medio-lateral position of external auditory meatus
SG41. Position of foramen magnum relative to bitympanic line
SG44. Mandibular cross-sectional area at M1
SG46. Direction of mental foramen opening
SG47. Hollowing above and behind mental foramen
SG48. Width of mandibular extramolar sulcus
SG52. Prominence of median lingual ridge of mandibular canine
SG55. d M_1 mesial crown profile
states: MMR absent, protoconid anterior, fovea open
MMR slight, protoconid anterior, fovea open
MMR thick, protoconid even with metaconid, fovea closed

characters.name: SG56. Distal marginal ridge of d M_2
SG57. Positions of buccal and lingual cusps relative to crown margin (states as for mandibular teeth; reverse for maxillary teeth)
states: Buccal and lingual cusps approximate crown margin
Lingual cusps approximate margin; buccal cusps slightly lingual to margin
Lingual cusps approximate margin; buccal cusps moderately lingual to margin
Lingual cusps slightly buccal to margin; buccal cusps moderately lingual to margin
Lingual cusps moderately buccal to margin; buccal cusps strongly lingual to margin

characters.name: SG58. Frequency of well developed P_3 metaconid
SG61. Mesiobuccal protrusion of P_3 crown base
SG62. Orientation of mandibular premolar row (dental arcade shape)
SG66. Separation of mandibular tooth rows
SG67. Configuration of the superior orbital fissure
SG69. Height of articular eminence above occlusal plane
SG70. Extensive mesial groove on upper canine
CW2. Orientation and length of the post-incisive planum
CW3. Distinctiveness of angular process of mandible
CW19. Position of infraorbital foramen relative to orbit
states: Foramen beneath middle third of orbital breadth
Foramen beneath medial third of orbital breadth

characters.name: CW22. Glabellar prominence relative to sella
states: Intermediate, at the level of sella

characters.name: CW32. Position of zygomatic foramina
states: At or below plane of orbital rim

characters.name: CW35. Patency of premaxillary suture in adults from frontal view
CW36. Petrous apex ossified beyond spheno-occipital synchondrosis
CW40. I^2 similar in shape to I^1
CW42. Basal keel of lower canine
CW43. Basal area of paracone of P^3
CW50. Distal trigonid crest on dp_4
CW52. Protocone dp^3, in occlusal view
CW55. Protocristid groove of lower molars
CW56. Lingual marginal ridges of molars
CW78. Mandibular corpus depth along tooth row

Table3-modified.notes: This is Table 3, but with variable characters converted to polymorphisms, orthogonal characters split, and 2-state range characters converted to discrete characters (for optimization).
